title: Every single game in my past 20 is a stomp.
body:
In 3/4 of them one team had more than double the enemy's kills, the rest are almost double.
The longest game was 36 minutes, but was not even close.  The enemy team just didn't surrender.
Most of the games were 20-30 minutes, but were decided long before then, and not a single game had a comeback.

Riot fix your shit, the game quality here is not good at all.

replies.body:
Mine havent been. Havent been playing a lot recently, but my last 2 SR games looked like this:

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2443341466/209139549?tab=overview

Our bot lane fed their Draven early. Was able to focus our solo lanes enough to get them going and we won.

Next game I got autofilled support. My team was behind the whole game, but we were able to pull it together when we grouped and won

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2443296705/209139549?tab=overview

Honestly it sounds like you just tilt way too easily and play extremely poor when behind. Comebacks happen all the time. Especially in SoloQ

EDIT:  Here's another back and forth game

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2441691325/209139549?tab=overview

And another one

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2441922240/209139549?tab=overview

I'll admit I'm not completely immune to tilt, but I'm not one to give up.  I don't surrender unless it's a complete stomp, and I will 1v5 at my nexus if I have to.  I pointed out that my past 20 games are stomps because statistically that means something.  One team gets ahead and then their win is often inevitable, whether it's me, my team, or the enemy team.  This is mostly a laning problem.  When I jungle I can always keep out of the team kda and don't have to worry to much about farming, but when I'm in a stat stick lane like jugg v jugg top, crit-based adc matchups, or heavy poke lanes there's no avoiding it.  If the enemy gets even 1 kill, they can use that lead to bully low-range enemies into never farming again.  Snowballing through stat-checking is insane right now.  The only way to stop a snowballer is through well-coordinated ganks and perfect knowledge of their weaknesses, which you can't really expect when you let them get ahead in the first place.

My point is, it's too easy to keep a lead.  When I'm fed I play reckless as hell, 1v3ing, taking drag while the entire enemy team is nearby, and usually it works out because in solo queue they can't expect to organize against you.  This might be a matchmaking issue, or it could be that I tilt more than I think I do, or play poorly from behind, but 20 games in a row of continual stomps (often with me not even in the mix) shows that something is wrong.

perhaps its just a matter of shifting focus. maybe the way that you play is more prone to stomping and being stomped, a high risk high reward playstyle.

When what you want is a low risk playstyle.
Please do not say all of you're last twenty games were stomps when around half of them were over thirty two minutes...

32 minutes is a stomp when the only reason is the losing team is full of optimists who won't surrender.  The games were decided long before then.  I checked the gold graphs of every game, none of them were close.  Some took off a little later, and some just took a while to go from inhib to nexus, but none of them were stalemates.
Is it fair to say you were the pessimist of the group?
No.  I won most of the long ones, the optimists were the enemy team.
there are no comebacks/back and forths, only throws
